subhed: As Christophe Gleizes, a reporter for So Press sentenced to seven years in prison, marks six months behind bars, the French Football Federation  is spotlighting his case during the round of 64 of the Coupe de France, taking place from December 19 to 21.

title: Bangladesh: Assassination of student protest leader sparks violence and heightens tensions with India
byline: By Sophie Landrin (New Delhi, India, correspondent)
subhed: The assailants who killed the young man reportedly fled to India, where former prime minister Sheikh Hasina has also taken refuge after being forced to resign following the protests of August 2024.

title: Da Vinci's secret tunnels at Milan's Sforza Castle appear to be nothing more than sewers
subhed: Researchers from the Politecnico di Milano claim to have discovered mysterious underground passages beneath the medieval fortress that match sketches by the Italian master. But historians specializing in the period sharply dispute this theory.

title: Santa Claus in France is a temp worker: 'It helps make ends meet'
subhed: Retirees, actors, entrepreneurs: They don the role of Santa Claus in shopping malls, at Christmas markets or via video calls for private customers. Few people rush to apply for this job, which sometimes involves difficult working conditions, although the most experienced among them still appreciate it.

title: A French farmer's distress: 'I found the first dead cow when I went to the pasture'
subhed: Near Benque, a village an hour from Toulouse, farmer Christian Lasserre discovered three carcasses on Saturday. He fears a new outbreak of lumpy skin disease and the culling of the entire herd.
